data.title: Richest Real Housewives of Miami, net worths ranked: from Larsa Pippen’s OnlyFans income and Lisa Hochstein’s plastic surgery empire, to Martina Navratilova and wife Julia Lemigova’s tennis millions
data.meta_description: Between Kim K’s former pal Larsa Pippen’s whopping OnlyFans earnings, Lisa Hochstein’s plastic surgery empire and Martina Navratilova’s tennis millions, who has the highest net worth?
data.text:
As a former Playboy model, reality star and the wife of prominent Miami plastic surgeon Dr. Leonard Hochstein, Lisa is officially the richest cast member.

Lisa and her husband also co-own the Hochstein Medspa, which they describe as “where luxury meets state-of-the-art technologies and treatments”.

2. Martina Navratilova, 65

Estimated net worth: US$25 million

The Czechoslovakian-American tennis player is widely considered one of the greatest players of the sport of all time – and now she’s also dabbling in reality TV! Yep, the 65-year-old tennis icon appears on RHOM as the wife of cast member Julia Lemigova.

Not surprisingly, Navratilova has accumulated an impressive estimated net worth of US$25 million until now. Best of all? She’s probably the most modest star on the show, and has turned her Miami mansion into an actual farm house.

3. Marysol Patton (friend), 55

Estimated net worth: US$15 million

After running one of the premiere public relations firms in the city, The Patton Group, Patton started off as a cast member and has returned to the reboot as a friend of the cast.

In April 2021, the 55-year-old businesswoman married Steve McNamara in Tulum, Mexico, in a traditional Mayan ceremony lead by a shaman.

4. Larsa Pippen, 47

Estimated net worth: US$10 million

Larsa Pippen rose to fame as the wife of NBA star Scottie Pippen, but the pair called it quits in 2018 after 21 years of marriage.

5. Adriana de Moura (friend), 56

Estimated net worth: US$10 million

Adriana de Moura, best known as the “Brazilian bombshell of the Miami art scene”, appeared on the earlier seasons of the show, which followed her luxurious life with then-fiancé, Frederic Marq. The couple eventually got married in front of the show’s cameras.

Since then, they separated in 2020, and the newly single reality TV star has returned as a friend of the cast for the latest season.

6. Alexia Echevarria, 54

Estimated net worth: US$3 million dollars

Cuban-born Alexia Echevarria is back for more drama following her wedding to Todd Nepola in St. Barths back in December 2021. The ceremony took place four months after the death of her mother Nancy, who died of Covid-19 on the same day Echevarria was previously meant to get married.

The reality star was previously married to Herman Echevarria, who died in 2016. If anyone deserves a pleasant season four, it’s Echevarria.

7. Nicole Martin, age unknown (but believed to be 36)

Estimated net worth: US$2.5-3 million

Dr. Nicole Martin is one of the three newcomers on season four, and she’s wasted no time dazzling viewers with her charm.

8. Guerdy Abraira, 43

Estimated net worth: US$2-3 million

Born in Haiti, and raised in Paris and Miami, newcomer Guerdy Abraira is the fabulous party planner of the group. Back at home, she’s a mum of two boys and has been with her high school sweetheart husband for 26 years.

With her company Guerdy Design cementing her as one of the top planners in the world, Abraira has only started making her millions.

9. Julia Lemigova, 49

Estimated net worth: US$1-3 million

Another newcomer, Julia Lemigova is a Russian former model and was crowned Miss USSR 1990.

Lemigova and her wife Navratilova have made reality TV history this season by becoming the first ever same-sex couple to be featured on the Housewives franchise.

She was previously in a relationship with banker Édouard Stern. The couple had a son, Maximilian, who died of shaken baby syndrome following the appointment of a new nanny.

10. Kiki Barth (friend), 32

Estimated net worth: US$1-1.5 million

Kiki Barth is a model, mum and former Miss Haiti who joins season four as a friend of the cast.

Following her move from Haiti to the US aged 13, she started her modelling career at age 16 to provide for her family, and bagged her first big break on a Bobbi Brown project.
